claim_text: Pam Bondi testified before the House Judiciary Committee on February 11, 2026.
notes: Verified by committee hearing page and coverage records.

claim_text: The Epstein Files Transparency Act (H.R. 4405) was enacted on November 19, 2025.
notes: Confirmed by GovTrack status + Public Law link.

claim_text: DOJ announced publication of 3.5 million responsive pages related to Epstein files on January 30, 2026.
notes: Based on DOJ OPA release statement.

claim_text: AP reported Casey Wasserman planned to sell his talent agency after publication of emails involving Ghislaine Maxwell.
notes: Secondary-source report; downgraded pending primary corroboration in repository.

claim_text: Reuters reported DOJ sent lawmakers a Feb. 15, 2026 letter describing redaction rationale and stating four newly discussed individuals were not directly tied to wrongdoing in reviewed records.
notes: Secondary-source summary of DOJ letter language; downgraded pending primary DOJ letter artifact.

claim_text: AP reported file excerpts described Epstein referencing Nobel committee leadership in outreach messages to high-profile contacts.
notes: Secondary-source summary pending primary record chain in repository.

claim_text: AP reported some U.S. school districts paused or canceled Lifetouch sessions after viral posts made Epstein-related allegations.
notes: Secondary-source report of district responses to viral claims; downgraded pending primary district records.

claim_text: AP reported Howard Lutnick acknowledged pre-government meetings with Epstein and that prior denials were inaccurate.
notes: Secondary-source report; downgraded pending primary corroboration in repository.

claim_text: Reuters and CNN reported DOJ sent lawmakers a summary covering over 300 officials and politically exposed persons in Epstein-related records, while stating inclusion in that summary does not itself establish wrongdoing.
notes: Secondary-source summaries of DOJ's Feb. 14 letter; downgraded pending primary DOJ letter artifact.
